data.text:
Dining at Jacob’s Pillow

Enjoy outdoor food, drink, and merriment at Jacob’s Pillow at our cafe, pub, and coffee bar. Questions? Contact restaurant@jacobspillow.org.

The Pillow Cafe

The Pillow Cafe offers table service with a lovely view of the Ted Shawn Theatre, with hand-crafted specialty cocktails in an open-air summer tent during our Summer Festival season. Please note: menus are subject to change.

The Pillow Cafe will open on Wednesday, June 26, 2024 for opening night of Festival 2024.

Friday-Sunday: 12-3pm

The Pillow Pub offers lighter fare, including salads, wraps, and sandwiches, all available as takeaway meals to be enjoyed around the Pillow’s 220-acre campus.

Pillow Coffee Bar

The Pillow Coffee Bar is a quick-service counter featuring a menu of coffees, teas, beverages, and snacks. It’s the perfect pitstop to fuel your Pillow experience!

Pillow Picnic Meals

Enjoy a picnic at the Pillow by reserving your meal in advance. Order a picnic meal up to 72 hours in advance of your visit, and pick it up at the Pillow Pub starting at noon. Pillow Picnic Meals serve 2 adults.

Meet the Chef

Executive Chef Stephen Will

Growing up in the Berkshires, Executive Chef Stephen Will developed a deep connection with the stunning natural landscapes of the region and a passion for using the freshest, highest-quality ingredients from local organic farms and orchards. To create a seasonal menu that reflects the area, he leverages his strong relationships with regional farmers and food producers, as well as his love of gardening and foraging.

It was here in the Berkshires that Chef Stephen learned the importance of spending time in the soil where the foods he works with grow and flourish. This concept is paramount to his style and approach to cooking. He believes that good soil is crucial for the roots of plants to thrive, which translates to a deep respect and love for food and a healthy lifestyle. This belief is still true to this day.

With years of experience working in various local restaurants and prestigious private schools, as well as serving as an Executive Chef at Bousquet Ski Mountain and Lake Placid Convention Center, Chef Stephen brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise to Jacob’s Pillow. His passion for cooking and exploring new cuisines was ignited at an early age, and over the years, he has developed a healthy and adventurous food aesthetic that is reflected in his bold and colorful palette. Entering his second season at Jacob’s Pillow, Chef Stephen is excited to bring back his expertise, knowledge and unique flavors to your dining experience at the premiere, world-famous dance festival.
